metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27618 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.

notes.Note: sbeattie> addressing this issue likely also depends on addressing CVE-2016-10228 which is upstream commit 91927b7c76 ("Rewrite iconv option parsing [BZ #19519]") in older versions on glibc, but is a pretty significant change.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
